data.name: BarracksL1
data.value:
I see you have decent silver production, therefore you should now consider recruiting some troops.

Build Barrack next.

data.name: RecruitTroops_CM
data.value:
I see that you have Barracks built, therefore your next step should be to recruit some troops.

Both Citizen Militia (CM) and Infantry (I) are good at defending your village, however, Citizen Militia are much cheaper to recruit. Therefore at the beginning, it's a good strategy to recruit Citizen Militia instead of Infantry and use the left over silver to continue expanding your village (i.e. upgrading buildings).

A good rule of thumb is to recruit at least 20-40 CM per day if you are already part of a strong clan without current enemies. Increase that if you are in danger.

In order to recruit troops, find the Troops... link on top left of the screen. Select Recruit from the drop down menu.

data.name: SilverMineToLevel10
data.value:
Your first priority should be to develop good silver production. Therefore I suggest you upgrade your silver mine to at least level 10 before you build anything else.

If you do not know how to upgrade buildings, I strongly suggest you go through the short beginner tutorial. Click the help icon and select "Beginner Tutorial"

data.name: Clan
data.value:
It's time for you to consider joining a clan. A Clan is an alliance of players who choose to fight together for their mutual protection and glory.

Clans normally do not go to war with each other lightly therefore being in a clan increases your chances of not being attacked early on. Players not affiliated with a clan are vulnerable to attacks from stronger players. Also note that clans normally resist accepting members who are already at war with someone, therefore it's a good idea to join a clan early.

To join a clan, browse the map and see what clans your neighbours are part of. Read about them and find one you like, preferably one with a lot of other clan members near you. Then contact the leaders and ask to be invited. You will get a report telling you an invitation has been dispatched.

data.name: SilverMineTOLevel15
data.value:
Now that you are able to recruit defensive troops like Citizen Militia (and you should be recruiting them daily), concentrate on building up your mine even more, to at least level 15 before you upgrade any other buildings.

In fact, upgrading your silver mine to level 15 should be considered a minimum at this point. You should be aggressively upgrading your silver mine in general - going up one or two levels per day until level 20 or even 30.

data.name: Tavern
data.value:
At this point I would recommend you build a Tavern. A Tavern is necessary to recruit Spies. What better place to find and recruit people who are good at not being seen than those hiding in medieval taverns! Spies are used to discover what buildings, troops, etc a village has.

At this point it's probably not a good idea to aggravate your neighbours by spying on them, so this is not why you will be recruiting spies. Spies are also used to protect yourself from being spied on - a counter-intelligence measure. If you have spies in your village, there is a smaller chance that enemy spies will be successful in penetrating your defenses and finding out details of your village, and a greater chance that you will know who attempted to spy on you. Therefore, build a Tavern and recruit some spies now.

To learn more about spies and spying, click on the spy icon when ever you see it (or Choose Units from the Help menu )

data.name: RecruitSpies
data.value:
Now that you have a Tavern built, it's time you recruit Spies. Spies are used to discover what buildings, troops, etc a village has.

At this point its probably not a good idea to aggravate your neighbours by spying on them so this is not why you will be recruiting spies. Spies are also used to protect yourself from being spied on - a counter-intelligence measure. If you have spies in your village, there is a smaller chance that enemy spies will be successful in penetrating your defenses and finding out details of your village, and a greater chance that you will know who attempted to spy on you. Therefore, recruit some spies next. Recruit 2-3 spies per day until you get about 10 spies, and then continue recruiting 1 spy per day when possible.

To learn more on how spies works, click on the spy icon where ever you see it (or Choose Units from Help menu )

data.name: BuildStable
data.value:
I see you have not yet built the Stable. In Stables you recruit mounted units which are your fastest and best offensive units.

Build the stable now.

data.name: RecruitLC
data.value:
I see you have the stable built. In Stables you recruit Light Cavalry and Knights which are your best offensive units.

Light Cavalry is a cheaper, but less efficient alternative to Knights. Although later on you will want to recruit only Knights, right now, since you still need lots of silver to build up your village, it's probably a good idea to prefer the cheaper alternative - Light Cavalry.

Although you are not yet in the position to attack anyone, you can use your Light Cavalry to plunder silver from surrounding villages of inactive players. I will explain this later, first, recruit some Light Cavalry and continue recruiting more on daily basis.

data.name: Recruit10Spies
data.value: You need to protect yourself from being spied on, you should recruit at least 10 spies before proceeding further.

data.name: SpyOnVillages
data.value:
It's a good idea now to consider plundering surrounding villages of inactive players for silver. If a player stops playing, his village is still producing silver and if you attack it, you can plunder this silver. This is a very useful strategy to get more silver than you would normally get just from your silver mine.

First step is to find an inactive village - find a village near you, that has very few points, and is not increasing in points. This is likely an inactive player. You can always message the player as well and see if you get a response.

Secondly, spy on this village. Send at least 5 spies to ensure a good chance of success - you do that by simply clicking this village on the map, and choosing Attack.

Once your spy attack occurs, you will get a report telling you what troops are stationed in this village, how much silver is currently in the treasury etc. You can use this information to find out how many troops you must send in order to kill all the troops in this village - use the Battle Simulator for this purpose (from the Troops... menu, select Battle Simulator). Remember that you will only plunder silver if you kill off all troops in this village. You will have to decide if you should wait to recruit more troops before attacking, or if you have enough already.

Once you decide to attack, attack this village in the same way. The troops that survive the attack will bring back silver for you to use. And since you killed off troops in this village, you can repeat this attack daily.

data.name: Wall
data.value:
I would recommend you now start building up your wall.

A Wall allows your soldiers to defend your village more efficiently meaning you will need fewer troops to defend yourself against attacks.

Every level of the wall gives you a certain percentage defense bonus so the higher the wall, the higher the defense bonus.

You can see exactly what this bonus is, if you click the Help icon , and choose Buildings.

data.name: DefensiveTowers
data.value: Just like wall, defensive towers allow your soldiers to defend your village more efficiently meaning you will need fewer troops to defend yourself against attacks. Defensive towers can only be destroyed by Trebuchets.

data.name: BarrackLevels15
data.value:
You should consider upgrading your Barracks. Higher the level of your barracks, faster are the Citizen Militia and Infantry recruited.

Recruiting an army takes a VERY long time and if you get attacked, you want to be able to rebuild your forces as fast as you can. You can accomplish this by upgrading your barracks.

As an example, at barracks level 1, it takes {0} Min {1} Sec to recruit 1 Citizen Militia. At level 20, it only takes {2} Min {3} Sec .

Upgrade your Barracks to at least level 15.

data.name: Stable
data.value:
You should consider upgrading your Stable. The higher the level of your Stable, the faster Knights and Light Cavalry recruit.

Recruiting an army takes a VERY long time. Light Cavalry and Knights are you main attack force, so the higher the level of Stable, the sooner you can recruit your offensive army.

In addition, a Stable is a requirement for building a Palace which you will need when you decide to take over another village

Upgrade your Stables to level 10 at least

data.name: HQLevel
data.value:
By now you probably noticed that it takes longer and longer to upgrade buildings. The higher the level, the longer it takes.

However, as you upgrade the Headquarters building, you shorten the time it takes to upgrade other buildings - your workers and infrastructure improves with every Headquarters' level resulting in quicker construction time.

Therefore once you find that it takes too long to upgrade certain buildings, upgrade your Headquarters. Also remember that Headquarters level 20 is necessary to build a Palace which you will need when you decide to take over another village

data.name: SiegeWorkshopNotBuilt
data.value:
At this point you should consider building a Siege Workshop. This is necessary for you to be able to construct siege machinery such as Rams and Trebuchets. Both are critical in attacking other village as they destroy the defensive wall and towers thus nullifying or lessening their defense bonus.

If you attack a village with a level 10 wall and level 10 towers, it will be very difficult to win. However, if you include Rams and Trebuchets in your attack, then you will be able to destroy or damage the wall and towers and the defending forces will get less of a defense bonus.

You should experiment with the Battle Simulator to see how Rams and Trebuchet perform on wall & towers of various levels.

So, build the Siege Workshop so that you can slowly begin constructing Rams and Trebuchet.

data.name: SiegeWorkshopBuilt
data.value:
I see you have already constructed the Siege Workshop which is necessary for you to be able to construct siege machinary such as Rams and Trebuchet. Both are critical in attacking other village as they destroy the defensive wall and towers thus nullifying or lessening their defense bonus.

If you attack a village with full wall and towers, it will be very difficult to win but if you include Rams and Trebuchet in your attack, then you will be able to destroy or damage the wall and towers and the defending forces will get less of a defense bonus.

You should experiment with the Battle Simulator to see how Rams and Trebuchet perform on wall & towers of various levels.

data.name: SilverMineToLevel35
data.value:
You should now concentrate on upgrading your silver mine. Upgrade it to at least level 35.

You are getting closer to the point where you might want to start thinking of expanding your empire. However, you should not consider it until you have good silver production.

data.name: RecruitEnoughTroops
data.value:
My next suggestion would be to build a Palace and prepare to expand your empire, however, I see you do not have many defensive troops.

Before going any further, I suggest you recruit at least 5000 Citizen Militia or Infantry.

I know this sounds like a lot, however, one of the biggest mistakes you can make is to gather more territory than you can defend.

data.name: Palace
data.value:
As you continue to build more troops, you might want to start thinking about expanding your empire by conquering your first village.

For this you will need to build the Palace. Palace is where you will recruit governors. Governors are required to conquer other villages.

data.name: RecruitGovernor
data.value:
Now that you have a Palace built, you can recruit a Governor.

Governors are used to capture other villages. In order to take control of another village, you need an administrator who will control it and keep the peace.

When you send an attack with a governor present, and the governor survives the attack, he tries to persuade members of the Council of Elders to accept you as their new ruler. You will have to attack a few times, until the Council of Elders' approval for the current regime falls to or below 49% at this point the village becomes yours!

So, I recommend you recruit a governor, and begin to look around you on the map and find a suitable target! Good luck!!

data.name: TradePost
data.value:
It is now the right time to build or upgrade your trade post.This will allow you to send silver to your newly acquired village.

Higher the level of the trade post more the silver can be sent; thereby helping you to build up your new village faster.

You do not need a trade post in your new village in order to receive silver.

data.name: Specialize
data.value:
Congratulations!! I see you have expanded your empire!

With more than 1 village, you should consider specializing your villages. Let me explain by example - creating an attack army.

You probably already know that Knights are your most efficient offensive force (a few simulations using the Battle Simulator can easily show that). So if you will attack another village, you want to attack with as many Knights as possible. But, villages are limited, by the food available, to a certain number of troops only. So if you recruit troops other than Knights in a village, you will at the end be able to recruit fewer Knights, meaning a smaller attack army (keep in mind that you cannot combine attacking armies from multiple village). Therefore, ideally, you would want to recruit only Knights (and Rams and Trebuchet of course) in one of your villages in order to have the largest possible offensive army.

Therefore start thinking whether you want to specialize your villages in such a way.

Same applies for other troops like spies. Rather than recruiting 100 spies in both of your villages, recruit 200 spies in one of your villages and none in another one. This will allow you to spy on someone with 200 spies rather than with just 100 resulting in greater chance for success.

data.name: TheEnd
data.value:
My Liege, I fear I have no more advice to offer... You have proven to be a great leader and have learned all the lessons of managing your kingdom well! Make sure you keep in contact with your clan members to form strategies and plan battles.

Continue doing what you have been doing and lead us into GLORY!
